text: Johann von Blatten, O.F.M. (died 1461) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Auxiliary Bishop of Konstanz (1441–1461)."Bishop Johann von Blatten, O.F.M. " Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved July 23, 2016"Diocese of Konstanz {Constance}" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved February 29, 2016"Diocese of Konstanz" GCatholic.org. Gabriel Chow. Retrieved February 29, 2016 ==Biography== Johann von Blatten was ordained a priest in the Order of Friars Minor. On 30 Jan 1441, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Eugene IV as Auxiliary Bishop of Konstanz and Titular Bishop of Belline. He served as Auxiliary Bishop of Konstanz until his resignation on 4 Jan 1461. He died in Dec 1461. While bishop, he was the principal co-consecrator of Arnold von Rotperg, Bishop of Basel (1451). == See also == *Catholic Church in Germany == References == Category:15th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Eugene IV Category:1461 deaths Category:Franciscan bishops
title: Johann von Blatten
